documenttitle.text: Red Hat Bug Fix Advisory: Red Hat Satellite 6.2 Capsule and Server

note.text: Red Hat Satellite 6.2 now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and 7
note.title: Topic

note.text:
Red Hat Satellite is a systems management tool for Linux-based 
infrastructures. It allows for provisioning, remote management and 
monitoring of multiple Linux deployments with a single, centralized tool. 
It performs provisioning and configuration management of predefined 
standard operating environments.

This update provides Satellite 6.2 packages for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 and 7 Satellite server. For the full list of new features provided by Satellite 6.2 see the Release Notes linked to in the references section. Please see the Satellite 6 Installation Guide for detailed instructions on how to install or upgrade from prior versions of Satellite 6.

All users who require Satellite version 6.2 are advised to install these new packages.

Changes to the Capsule component:

* Kerberos issues with IPA Realm integration would cause provisioning to fail in Satellite 6.1. This has been resolved in Satellite 6.2, and provisioning will work with this setup. (BZ#1305402)

Changes to the Compute Resources component:

* Satellite 6.2 features performance fixes, including provisioning to clusters if they are contained in a nested folder. (BZ#1314090)

Changes to the Content Management component:

* This release introduces the ability to provision Red Hat Atomic Host in addition to standard Red Hat Enterprise Linux. This includes syncing down Atomic Content, promoting that content through a lifecycle environment, and provisioning Atomic Hosts. (BZ#1315043)

* With this release, users of Red Hat Satellite 6.2 can sync down repositories protected by basic authentication by providing the username and password in the repository string. (BZ#1174948)

* Elastic Search has been removed from Red Hat Satellite. It has been replaced by the standard searching provided by the database. (BZ#1259374)

* With this release, the content dashboard in Red Hat Satellite 6.1 has now been combined into the main dashboard, providing a single point of summary information for the user. (BZ#1146874)

Changes to the Content Views component:

* Satellite 6.2 provides improvements to Bulk Actions and Host Collections. Changing the content view in the web UI now works as intended. (BZ#1315280)

* With this release, content view versions in Red Hat Satellite 6.2 have been improved to show the version of the puppet module that is included. (BZ#1241975)

Changes to the Disconnected component:

* This release introduces the ability to export content from one Satellite Server and import it into another server. The content can come from the Library, or can be from a content view. This feature can be used to support populating an air-gapped server with content from another server. (BZ#1127456)

Changes to the Pulp component:

* Satellite 6.2 provides substantial improvements to content synchronization. These improvements include improved messages in cases where content synchronization is considered successful, even though one or more packages failed to download. (BZ#1292953)

Changes to the Remote Execution component:

* This release adds a Remote Execution feature that allows users to execute commands against machines under inventory. The commands can be stored as jobs, and can be scheduled to run in the future or on a recurring basis. (BZ#1131296)

Changes to the Subscription Management component:

* With this release, the virt-who agent can now be installed on the same machine where the main Satellite Server is hosted. (BZ#1209467)
note.title: Details

note.text: Foreman after 1.1 and before 1.9.0-RC1 does not redirect HTTP requests to HTTPS when the require_ssl setting is set to true, which allows remote attackers to obtain user credentials via a man-in-the-middle attack.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied and that the Satellite is updated to the most recent 6.1.x release. 

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en/red-hat-satellite/6.2/single/installation-guide#upgrading_satellite_server_and_capsule_server

reference.Description: bz#1243571: CVE-2015-5152 Foreman: API permits HTTP requests when require_ssl is enabled

note.text: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Foreman 1.7.0 and after.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied and that the Satellite is updated to the most recent 6.1.x release. 

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en/red-hat-satellite/6.2/single/installation-guide#upgrading_satellite_server_and_capsule_server

reference.Description: bz#1264221: CVE-2015-5282 foreman: XSS in hidden parameter value switcher

note.text: It was found that the private key for the node certificate was contained in a world-readable file. A local user could possibly use this flaw to gain access to the private key information in the file.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied and that the Satellite is updated to the most recent 6.1.x release. 

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en/red-hat-satellite/6.2/single/installation-guide#upgrading_satellite_server_and_capsule_server

reference.Description: bz#1325930: CVE-2016-3107 pulp: Node certificate containing private key stored in world-readable file

acknowledgment.Description: This issue was discovered by Jeremy Cline (Red Hat) and Randy Barlow (Red Hat).

note.text: It was found that the private key for the node certificate was contained in a world-readable temporary file. A local user could possibly use this flaw to gain access to the private key information in the temporary file.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied and that the Satellite is updated to the most recent 6.1.x release. 

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en/red-hat-satellite/6.2/single/installation-guide#upgrading_satellite_server_and_capsule_server

reference.Description: bz#1325934: CVE-2016-3108 pulp: Insecure temporary file used when generating certificate for Pulp Nodes

acknowledgment.Description: This issue was discovered by Jeremy Cline (Red Hat) and Sander Bos.

note.text: It was found that the private RSA key was created in a directory that is world-readable for a small amount of time. A local user could possibly use this flaw to gain access to the private key information in the file.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied and that the Satellite is updated to the most recent 6.1.x release. 

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en/red-hat-satellite/6.2/single/installation-guide#upgrading_satellite_server_and_capsule_server

reference.Description: bz#1326251: CVE-2016-3111 pulp: Race condition when generating RSA keys for authenticating messages between server and consumers

acknowledgment.Description: This issue was discovered by Jeremy Cline (Red Hat).

note.text: It was found that the private key for the agent certificate was contained in a world-readable file. A local user could possibly use this flaw to gain access to the private key information in the file.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied and that the Satellite is updated to the most recent 6.1.x release. 

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en/red-hat-satellite/6.2/single/installation-guide#upgrading_satellite_server_and_capsule_server

reference.Description: bz#1326242: CVE-2016-3112 pulp: Agent certificate containing private key is stored in world-readable file

acknowledgment.Description: This issue was discovered by Jeremy Cline (Red Hat).

note.text: It was found that the âvariantâ parameter in the TFTP API of Foreman was passed to the eval() function. An attacker could possibly use this flaw to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the Foreman user.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied and that the Satellite is updated to the most recent 6.1.x release. 

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en/red-hat-satellite/6.2/single/installation-guide#upgrading_satellite_server_and_capsule_server

reference.Description: bz#1333378: CVE-2016-3728 foreman: Missing input validation in Smart Proxy allows RCE via TFTP file variant parameter

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank the Foreman project for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Lukas Zapletal (Red Hat) as the original reporter.
